Fun Fact: Have existed for more than 30 million years on Earth.
Estimated Population Size: Between 3,000 and 4,500 depending upon the species
Biggest Threat: Poaching for meat and hides / habitat loss.
Most Distinctive Feature: Elongated snout and upper lip that is reminiscent of an aardvark’s nose.
Other Name(s): Baird’s Tapir, Little Black Tapir, Wooly Tapir, Asian / Indian Tapir
Predators: Crocodiles, jaguars, tigers, cougars and other wild cats.
Common Name: Central American Tapir, Kabomani Tapir, Mountain Tapir and the Malayan Tapir
Location: Central America, South America and Asia
Slogan: Most closely related to horses and rhinos!
Height: Between 29 and 42 inches from the shoulder.
Name: Tapir
